author: jvanzyl
msg: o Reverting my changes. I think the whole dynamic tag thing needs some
reworking. You can't access anything do any sort of communication
between the dynamic tags and the plugin jelly script in maven unless
the exporting/inheritence is turned on and there doesn't appear to
be an easy way to do this (not impossible, i just don't feel like
doing it at the moment). I turned on inheritence/exporting by
default and now I'm getting all sorts of argument type mismatches
so I guess something similiar needs to be done that was done
to make the Ant tags work.

author: jvanzyl
msg: o Making the newly created context available in the dynamic tag.
James, if this is evil let me know. But in other jelly scripts I have
access to the context which is very convenient. In this particular case
I am trying to access the maven POM inside a dynamic tag lib and I couldn't

author: jstrachan
msg: Fixed the build so that the jelly scripts now appear to work - so Jelly can now be run from the command line like Ant and Maven - provided that the JELLY_HOME is set

author: jstrachan
msg: Patched the dist:build target so that now all the dependent jars go into the lib directory and the binary scripts to the bin directory.
For some reason the jelly.bat script doesn't quite work yet; it could be a minor issue with forehead. We're nearly there...
